page.title: 07THE EDINBURGH WOOLLEN MILL
page.content: The Edinburgh Woollen Mill which has 84 branches through the U.K.,came to Jedburgh in 1982.It is their biggest shop in the Borders.They sell lambswool,cashmere,Shetland and cotton,also angora, mostly as fashion skirts,jumpers and jerseys.A cashmere jumper is about Â£60.They also sell Shetland rugs which have been made in Shetland.These cost between Â£799 and Â£1299.In the shop they also sell Scottish food,dolls,postcards and jewellery. Each E.W.M.shop has the same layout.There are nine people employed in Jedburgh,four full-time,two part-time and three on Saturdays when they can sell as many as 150 garments per day.Nothing is made on the premises,nearly all the goods come from Langholm.Many tourists stop to buy at the shop.
